description: Looking for a viewer that allows multiple images to be floated/undocked/whatever, to view them side-by-side. If nomacs has that functionality, it's not easily found or it doesn't exist. Otherwise it's a good app.

Like almost every Linux App, Nomacs does a bunch of great stuff. I needed a borderless display for images to stream. Voila, nomacs does borderless! Perfect, what could go wrong? Select borderless, Shazam! No borders. Also no 80% of your screen and no access to any other program because it floats on top! I mean if I am displaying an image, I want it one inconvenient size, right? Don't want to be able to resize the image when frameless. And they thoughfully insured that no matter how you size it before going frameless BOOM! Right back to the giant economy block o apps size!  Besides that, it's great. Just like all the other Linux apps, they're fine, except for that one little thing that makes them unusable for what you need. On the plus side, it is hundreds of dollars less then Windows which has the same issues. I will see if I can put in a feature request or find a way around this. If I do, I will absolutely give this app 5 stars.
Finally, a simple and fast app that allows to crop, zoom and rotate (plus many extras) all within a nice looking interface.
The UI is not compatible with KDE's dark theme, at least not on Plasma 5.24
Would be nice if there was a way to preview images on folder order or last modified, instead of alphabetical order only

I've been looking for an ImageGlass (Windows) alternative for Linux and I tried several before finding this one. None of them could do what I needed. I needed to be able to quickly swap through very small images very quickly with arrow keys and close with the Escape key. 

I also needed quick zooming and saving zoom levels which this does! Quick rotating and bindable keys to me makes this the perfect image viewer for what I need it for. Nomacs combined with DoubleCommander makes Linux actually tolerable for sifting through the huge 900GB+ Geocities archive and I'm actually really loving Linux now. 

It's too bad Nomacs doesn't seem to be maintained anymore.
summary: Great for large archives like Geocities!

description: Great viewer, works really well with large (in the hundreds of MB) TIFF files
summary: Great with very large image files

description: Fast, very customizable, can open many image raw file formats (but not cr3). I am using it to open images in fullscreen mode, quiting with Ctrl+q, to view exif m or alt+m, histogram h.
Closest thing to irfanview on Linux. Much better than GNOME image viewer.

summary: А как добавить русский язык? (how to add russian language here?)

description:
only english language
только английский язык
